antiPatterns.name: Data Service
antiPatterns.description: This antipattern describes a service that performs only information retrieval or access operations and typically contains only of accessor operations.
antiPatterns.context: A service is built for simple information retrieval or access operations.
antiPatterns.detection: Typically only contains accessor operations, i.e., getters and setters and usually deals with very small messages of primitive types and may have high data cohesion.
antiPatterns.consequences: A consequence of the data service antipattern is that these services may have a high data cohesion.
sources: @article{Palma2014b, author={Palma, Francis and Moha, Naouel and Tremblay, Guy and Gu{\'e}h{\'e}neuc, Yann-Ga{\"e}l}, doi = {10.1007/978-3-319-09970-5_6}, isbn = {9783319099699}, issn = {16113349}, journal = {Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)}, pages = {58--73}, title = {{Specification and detection of SOA antipatterns in web services}}, volume = {8627 LNCS}, year = {2014}}

@inproceedings{ouni2015web, author = {Ouni, Ali and Gaikovina Kula, Raula and Kessentini, Marouane and Inoue, Katsuro}, title = {Web Service Antipatterns Detection Using Genetic Programming}, booktitle = {Proceedings of the 2015 Annual Conference on Genetic and Evolutionary Computation}, series = {GECCO '15}, year = {2015}, isbn = {978-1-4503-3472-3}, location = {Madrid, Spain}, pages = {1351--1358}, numpages = {8}, url = {http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/2739480.2754724}, doi = {10.1145/2739480.2754724}, acmid = {2754724}, publisher = {ACM}, address = {New York, NY, USA}}
